result.execSummary:
The defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 04-20-18.  Failure to pay will result in 15 days in the HOC, consecutive to any sentence.

NO Huber.
Court objects to ES.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope

records.addlTxt: Commitment Order for Non-Payment of Fine/ Forfeiture returned undeliverable by USPS
Copy of F&C Co to defendant and to Sheriff dept

signed and filed.
The defendant's motion or request for release privileges is DENIED.
The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.

Defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNTS 2,3,4 :  DISMISSED.

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve NINE MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  NO Huber privileges.  COURT OBJECTS TO ES.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees  and surcharges by 4-20-18 or, if not paid, serve 15 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence. 

 Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 30.   Court approves transfer to branch 30, Judge Conen for global resolution FORTHWITH.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47s  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Xzevyance L Pope not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has a pending felony case with Branch 30.  Defense received discovery today.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Xzevyance Lamanuel Pope in custody.  
James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Due to lower pending case in Br. 47, the parties are advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
